input_text: mā vade paruṣaṃ kaṃci vuttā paṭivadeyu taṃ |

input_text: sace iresi āttānaṃ kaṃso upahato-r-iva |

input_text: na ce iresi āttānaṃ kaṃso anupahato-r-iva |
target_text: If you make no sound like a gong that is not struck,

target_text: you are like one who has attained Nibbāna, contention is not found in you.

input_text: yathā daṇḍena gopālo gāvo pājeti gocaraṃ |
target_text: Like a cowherd with a stick drives cattle to pasture,

input_text: evaṃ jarā ca maccū ca prāṇināṃ adhivattati ||
target_text: so do old age and death overpower living beings.

input_text: yathā daṇḍena gopālo gāvo rakṣati sāmināṃ |
target_text: Like a cowherd with a stick protects the owner’s cattle,

input_text: evaṃ rakkhatha āttānaṃ khaṇo vo mā upaccagū |
target_text: so one should watch over oneself, and you should not let the moment pass,

input_text: khaṇātītā hi śocanti nirayamhi samappitā ||
target_text: for when the chance has passed they grieve when consigned to the underworld.

input_text: sabbe trasanti daṇḍānāṃ sabbesaṃ jīvitaṃ priyaṃ |
target_text: Everyone trembles at sticks, for all of them life is dear,

input_text: āttānaṃ upamaṃ kattā neva haṃyyā na ghātaye ||
target_text: comparing oneself with others, one should not hurt or have them hurt.

input_text: sukhakāmāni bhūtāni yo daṇḍena vihiṃsati |
target_text: One who harms with a stick beings who desire happiness,

input_text: āttano sukham eṣāṇo precca so na labhate sukhaṃ ||
target_text: while seeking happiness for himself, won’t find happiness after death.

input_text: sukhakāmāni bhūtāni yo daṇḍena na vihiṃsati |
target_text: One who harms not with a stick beings who desire happiness,

input_text: āttano sukham eṣāṇo precca so labhate sukhaṃ ||
target_text: while seeking happiness for himself, will find happiness after death.

input_text: na bhajetha pāpake mitre na bhajetha puruṣā ’dhame |
target_text: One should not keep company with wicked friends, one should not keep company with the ignoble,

input_text: bhajetha praṃñe medhāvī bhajetha puruṣottame |
target_text: you should keep company with the sage and wise, you should keep company with superior people.

input_text: tārise bhajamānassa śreyo hoti na pāpiyo ||
target_text: keeping company with such is surely better for you, not worse.

input_text: nidhino va pravattāraṃ yaṃ paśśe vajjadaṃśinaṃ |
target_text: One should regard someone who shows your faults just like one who points out hidden treasure,

input_text: nigṛhyavādiṃ medhāvīṃ tārisaṃ puruṣaṃ bhaje |
target_text: one should keep company with such a sagacious person who reproves you;

input_text: ovadeyā anuśāseyā asabbhāto nivāraye |
target_text: One should advise and instruct, and forbid whatever is vile,

input_text: satāṃ hetaṃ priyaṃ hoti asatāṃ hoti apriyaṃ ||
target_text: for this is dear to the good, but it is not dear to the bad.

input_text: tassā satāñ ca asatāñ ca nānā hoti ito gatī |
target_text: Therefore the good and the bad from here go to various destinies,

input_text: asanto nirayaṃ yānti santo saggaparāyaṇā ||
target_text: the bad go to the underworld, the good cross over to heaven.

input_text: appaśśuto ayaṃ puruṣo balivaddo va jīrati |
target_text: The person of little learning increases in age like an ox,

input_text: māṃsāni tassa vaddhanti praṃñā tassa na vaddhati ||
target_text: for although his flesh does increase, his wisdom does not increase.

input_text: cattāri ṭṭhānāni naro pramatto āpajjate paradāropasevī |
target_text: There are four states the man who is heedless, the man who consorts with other man’s wives, undergoes:

target_text: he gains demerit, an uncomfortable bed, blame as third, and rebirth in the underworld as fourth.

input_text: apuṃñalābho ca gatī ca pāpiko bhītassa bhītāya ratī pi appikā |

target_text: and kings who apply heavy punishment, at the break up of the body he goes to the underworld.

input_text: saṃyyatā sugatiṃ yānti doggatiṃ yānti asaṃyyatā |

input_text: mā ssu viśśāsam āpādi iti vindu samaṃ care ||

target_text: As a lion wanders his mountain fortress, his resort on the mountainside,

input_text: ahaṃ nāgo va saṃggrāme cāpātipatite sare |
target_text: Like an elephant in battle endures arrows shot from bow

input_text: atīvāde titikkhāmi duśśīlo hi bahujano ||
target_text: so will I endure abuse, for many people are unvirtuous.

input_text: daṇḍavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about the Stick

input_text: abhittaretha kallāṇe pāpā cittaṃnivāraye|
target_text: Hasten to do wholesome deeds, ward off the mind from wickedness,

input_text: daṃdhaṃhikaratopuṃñaṃ pāpamhi ramatemano ||
target_text: for the mind of the one slow in merit delights in wickedness.

input_text: kayira ce puruṣo pāpaṃ na naṃ kayirā punappuno |
target_text: Should a person do that which is wicked, he should not do it again and again,

input_text: na tamhi chandaṃ kayirātha dukkho pāpassa saṃcayo ||
target_text: let him not place his intention in it, for there is an accumulation of suffering for the wicked one.

input_text: kayira ce puruṣo puṃñaṃ kayira cenaṃ punappuno |
target_text: If a person should make merit, he should do it again and again,

input_text: tamhi eva chandaṃ kayirātha sukho puṃñassa saṃcayo ||
target_text: let him place his intention there, there is an increase of joy for the one who has made merit.

input_text: śuddhasseva sadā phaggū suddasso ’poṣatho sadā |
target_text: For the pure one there is always fasting, for the pure one there is always the fast day,

input_text: śuddhassa śucikammassa sadā saṃpajjate vrataṃ ||
target_text: for the pure one, the one of clean deeds, his vow always succeeds.

input_text: akataṃ dukkataṃ śreyo pacchā tapati dukkataṃ |
target_text: Better undone is a wrong-doing, a wrong-doing one later regrets,

input_text: dukkataṃ me kataṃ ti śocati bhūyo śocati doggatiṃ gato ||

input_text: katañ ca sukataṃ sādhu yaṃ kattā nānutappati |
target_text: Better done is what is well-done, which, when done, one does not regret

input_text: sukataṃ me kataṃ ti nandati bhūyo nandati soggatiṅ gato ||
target_text: he is happy, thinking: “I have done a good deed,” gone to a good fate, he is happy much more.

input_text: pāpo pi paśśate bhadraṃ yāva pāpaṃ na paccati |
target_text: Even the wicked one experiences good fortune while the wickedness does not ripen,

input_text: yadā tu paccate pāpaṃ atha pāpo pāpāni paśśati ||
target_text: but when the wickedness ripens then the wicked one experiences wicked things.

input_text: bhadro pi paśśate pāpaṃ yāva bhadraṃ na paccati |
target_text: Even the fortunate one experiences wickedness as long as the good fortune does not ripen,

input_text: yadā tu paccate bhadraṃ atha bhadro bhadrāṇi paśśati ||
target_text: but when the fortune ripens then the fortunate one experiences good fortune.

input_text: pāpaṃ pi karato bhadraṃ yāva pāpaṃ na paccati |
target_text: Even the wicked one does good while the wickedness does not ripen,

input_text: atha payirāgate kāle pāpo pāpāni paśśati ||
target_text: but when the time has gone by the wicked one experiences wicked things.

input_text: bhadraṃ pi karato pāpaṃ yāva bhadraṃ na paccati |
target_text: Even the fortunate one does wickedness as long as the good fortune does not ripen,

input_text: atha payirāgate kāle bhadro bhadrāṇi paśśati ||
target_text: but when the time has gone by the fortunate one experiences good fortune.

input_text: pāṇimhi ce vraṇo nā ’ssa dhāreyā pāṇinā viṣaṃ |
target_text: If there is no wound for him in his hand he can carry poison with his hand,

input_text: nāvraṇe viṣam anneti nāsti pāpaṃ akurvvato ||

input_text: na hi pāpakaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ sajjaṃ chīraṃ va mucchati |
target_text: A wicked deed that has been done, like milk, does not turn all at once,

input_text: na hi pāpakaṃ kataṃ kammaṃ sajjaṃ śastam va kantati |
target_text: A wicked deed that has been done, like a knife, does not cut all at once,

input_text: maraṇo ’peto hi jānāti yā gatī pāpakaṃmuṇo ||
target_text: but when death comes he knows the destiny of those who do wickedness.

input_text: anāgataṃ paṭikayirātha kiccaṃ mā vo kiccaṃ kiccakāle vyadheyā |
target_text: You should prepare beforehand what is to be done, do not tremble at what is to be done at the time for it,

input_text: taṃ tārisaṃ paṭikatakiccakāriṃ na naṃ kiccaṃ kiccakāle vyadheti ||
target_text: for such a one who has prepared what is to be done, does not tremble at what is to be done at the time for it.

input_text: paṭikacceva taṃ kayirā yaṃ ñāyyā hitam āttano |
target_text: One should prepare to do that which one knows is for one’s welfare,

input_text: na śākaṭikamanti ssa mantaṃ dhīro parākrame ||
target_text: the sage, the wise one should make effort, not with the thinking of the charioteer.

input_text: yathā śākaṭiko māggaṃ samaṃ hettā mahāpathaṃ |
target_text: As the charioteer who abandoned the smooth path of the highway,

input_text: viṣamaṃ māggam āsājja akkhachinno tha jhāyati ||
target_text: and approached the rough path, then he broods, as upon a broken axle,

input_text: evaṃ dhammā apakrāṃma adhaṃmam anuvattiya |
target_text: so the one departing from Dhamma and following what is not Dhamma,

input_text: bālo maccumukhaṃ prātto akkhachinno va jhāyati ||
target_text: when that fool comes to Death’s jaws he broods, as upon a broken axle.

input_text: kāṣāyakaṃṭhā bahavo pāpadhaṃmā asaṃyyatā |
target_text: Many wearing the monastic robe around their necks are wicked, unrestrained.

input_text: pāpā pāpehi kaṃmehi nirayaṃ te upapajjatha ||
target_text: Wicked ones! Through your wicked deeds, you re-arise in the underworld.

input_text: abhūtavādī nirayaṃ upeti yo cāpi kattā na karomī ti āha |
target_text: One who speaks what is untrue goes to the underworld, he who says: ‘I do not do’ what he has done,

input_text: ubho pi te precca samā bhavanti nihīnakaṃmā manujā paratra ||
target_text: both of these are just the same when they have gone to the hereafter, they are humans who did base deeds.

input_text: yo apraduṣṭassa naro praduṣyati śuddhassa poṣassa anaṃgaṇassa |
target_text: He who offends against the inoffensive one, a purified and passionless person:

input_text: tam eva bālaṃ pracceti pāpaṃ sukhumo rajo paṭivātaṃ va khitto ||
target_text: that wicked deed then returns to the fool, like fine dust that is thrown against the wind.

input_text: vāṇijo va bhayaṃ māggaṃ appasāttho mahaddhano |
target_text: Like a merchant on a fearful path, with few friends and great wealth,

input_text: viṣaṃ jīvitukāmo va pāpāni parivajjaye ||
target_text: as one loving life would avoid poison, so should one avoid wicked deeds.

input_text: paradukkhopadhānena yo icche sukham āttano |
target_text: He who desires happiness for himself by causing suffering for another,

input_text: verasaṃsaggasaṃsaṭṭho dukkhā na parimuccati ||
target_text: being associated thus with hatred, is not fully released from suffering.

input_text: kuṇapassa pi gandhucchijjati u ’ddhukitassa pi rāti accayā |
target_text: The smell of a corpse is cut off eventually, also of one bloated when nights have passed,

input_text: puruṣassa adhammacāriṇo annāhaṃ gandho na chijjati ||
target_text: but of the man who lives not by Dhamma day by day his smell is never cut off.

input_text: yatha ggrahapatayo prabhūtaratanā āḍitte nagaramhi dahyamāne |
target_text: Just as householders having great treasures, when the city is on fire and burning,

input_text: muttāmaṇiphaṭikarajataheto vyāyamanti api nīharema kiṃci ||
target_text: because of their pearls, jewels, crystal and silver, make effort, thinking: “We will save something”,

input_text: tatha-r-iva śamaṇā prabhūtapraṃñā ayirā ayirapathesu sicchamānā |
target_text: so the ascetics of great wisdom, noble ones training along the noble path,

input_text: jātijarāmaraṇabhayāddittā dukkhāṭṭā vyāyamanti api prāpuṇema śāntiṃ ||
target_text: oppressed with the fear of birth, old age, death, afflicted by suffering, make effort, thinking: “We will attain peace”.

input_text: kalyāṇīvarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about the Wholesome

input_text: vācānurakkhī manasā susaṃvṛto kāyena yo akuśalaṃ na sevati|
target_text: Verbally guarded, well-restrained in mind, he who does not practice a wrong deed with the body,

input_text: etettayo kaṃmapathe viśodhiya prāppojja so śāntipadaṃ anuttaraṃ ||
target_text: purifying these three paths of action, would attain the unsurpassed state of peace.

input_text: kāyapradoṣaṃ rakkheyā kāyena saṃvṛto siyā |
target_text: One should guard against bodily faults, one should be restrained bodily,

input_text: kāyaduccaritaṃ hettā kāyena sucaritaṃ care ||
target_text: abandoning wrong bodily conduct, one should have good bodily conduct.

input_text: vācāpradoṣaṃ rakkheyā vācāya saṃvṛto siyā |
target_text: One should guard against verbal faults, one should be restrained verbally,

input_text: vācāduccaritaṃ hettā vācāya sucaritaṃ care ||
target_text: abandoning wrong verbal conduct, one should have good verbal conduct.

input_text: manapradoṣaṃ rakkheyā manasā saṃvṛto siyā |
target_text: One should guard against mental faults, one should be restrained mentally,

input_text: manoduccaritaṃ hettā manasā sucaritaṃ care ||
target_text: abandoning wrong mental conduct, one should have good mental conduct.

input_text: kāyena saṃvṛtā dhīrā vācāya utta cetasā |
target_text: The wise are restrained bodily, verbally and also mentally,

input_text: sabbattha saṃvṛtā dhīrā te ve suparisaṃvṛtā ||
target_text: the wise are restrained in every way, they are indeed very well-restrained.

input_text: porāṇam etaṃ ādhora na etaṃ ahunā-r-iva |
target_text: This is something of old, Ādhora, this is not something of today:

input_text: nindanti tohnim āsīnaṃ nindanti mitabhāṇikaṃ |
target_text: they blame the one who sits silently, they blame the one who talks in moderation,

input_text: bahubhāṇikaṃ pi nindanti nāsti loke anindito ||
target_text: they blame the one who talks a lot, there is no one in the world not blamed.

input_text: na cābhu na ca bhaviṣyati na cetarahi vijjati |
target_text: There was not and there will not be, and at present there is not found

input_text: ekāntanindito poṣo ekāntaṃ vā praśaṃsito ||
target_text: a person totally blameworthy, or one totally praiseworthy.

input_text: yañ ca bālā adhaṃmaṭṭhaṃ pūjeyu garaheyu vā |
target_text: He who would worship or reproach the one who is unrighteous,

input_text: aviñūṃ avibhāvāya na taṃ atthāya kāyaci ||
target_text: a fool with lack of intelligence, that is to no purpose.

input_text: yaṃ ca viñū praśaṃsanti anuvicca suve suve |
target_text: The one who, after being examined day by day, is praised by the wise,

input_text: acchidravattiṃ medhāviṃ praṃñāśīlasamāhitaṃ ||
target_text: faultless in conduct, sagacious, attending to virtue and wisdom,

input_text: nikkhaṃ jāṃbūnadasseva ko taṃ ninditum arihati |
target_text: one who is like a golden coin, who is there worthy to blame him?

input_text: devā pi naṃ praśansanti brahmuṇā pi praśaṃsito ||
target_text: That one is praised by the gods, and has been praised by the Brahmās too.

input_text: na vākkaraṇamātteṇa vannapukkhalatāya vā |
target_text: Not by eloquence only, or by a beautiful complexion,

input_text: sādhurūpī naro hoti iśśukī maccharī śaṭho ||
target_text: is a person honourable, if still jealous, selfish and deceitful.

input_text: yamhi saccaṃ ca dhammo ca viratī saṃyyamo damo |
target_text: In whom is truth, Dhamma, abstinence, restraint and good training,

input_text: sa vāntadoṣo medhāvī sādhurūpī ti vuccati ||
target_text: that sage who has thrown out hatred is said to be honourable.

input_text: bahuṃ pi ce sahitaṃ bhāṣamāno na takkaro hoti naro pramatto |
target_text: Even though reciting abundant scriptures, the heedless fellow, who does not do what they say,

input_text: gopo va gāvo gaṇayaṃ paresaṃ na bhāgavā śāmaṇṇassa hoti ||
target_text: like a cowboy counting other’s cattle, does not partake of the ascetic life.

input_text: appaṃ pi ce sahitaṃ bhāṣamāno dhammassa hoti anudhammacārī |
target_text: Even though reciting but few scriptures, but living righteously in accordance with Dhamma,

input_text: rāgaṃ ca doṣaṃ ca prahāya mohaṃ vimuttacitto akhilo akaṃcho |
target_text: abandoning greed, hate and delusion, with mind released, completely without doubt,

input_text: anupādiyāno iha vā hure vā sa bhāgavā śāmannassa hoti ||
target_text: that one, unattached here and hereafter, surely partakes of the ascetic life.

input_text: saccaṃ bhaṇe na kujjheyā deyā appā pi yācito |
target_text: One should speak out the truth, one should not get angry, when requested you should give, if only a little,

input_text: etehi ttihi ṭṭhāṇehi gacche devāna santike ||
target_text: through these three conditions one can go to the presence of the gods.

input_text: na ve kadāryyā devalokaṃ vrajanti bālā hi bhe na praśaṃsanti dānaṃ |
target_text: The miserly go not to the world of the gods, fools surely do not praise giving,

input_text: dhīro tu dānaṃ anumodamāno teneva so devalokaṃ pareti ||
target_text: but the wise one rejoices in giving, and through that he goes to the world of the gods.

input_text: śīlavantaṃ śuciṃ dacchaṃ dhammaṭṭhaṃ saccavādinaṃ |
target_text: Having virtue, being pure and clever, principled, knowing the truths,

input_text: āttano kārakaṃ śantaṃ taṃ jano kurute priyaṃ ||
target_text: the good one doing the deeds that are his own, that one the people love.

input_text: śreyo ayoguḍā bhuttā tattā aggiśikhopamā |
target_text: It’s better to have eaten glowing iron balls, like flames of fire,

input_text: yaṃ ca bhuñjeya duśśīlo rāṣṭapiṇḍaṃ asaṃyyato ||
target_text: than that the monastic who is unrestrained and unvirtuous should enjoy the country’s almsfood.

input_text: kuśo yathā duggṛhīto hastam evānukaṃtati |
target_text: As kusa grass, wrongly grasped, cuts into the hand,

input_text: śāmannaṃ dupparāmāṭṭhaṃ nirayāya upakaṭṭati ||
target_text: so does the ascetic life, wrongly grasped, drag one down to the underworld.

input_text: ekadhaṃmam atītassa muṣāvādissa jaṃtuno |
target_text: For the person speaking falsely, who has transgressed in this one thing,

input_text: vitinnaparalokassa nāsti pāpaṃ akāriyaṃ ||
target_text: who has abandoned the next world, there is no wickedness left undone.

input_text: na hi śastaṃ suniśitaṃ viṣaṃ hālāhalaṃ tathā |
target_text: For not a well-sharpened sword, or even deadly poison,

input_text: evaṃ khipraṃ atipāteti vācā dubbhāṣitā yathā ||
target_text: destroy quite as quickly as words that are badly spoken.

input_text: puruṣassa jāyamānassa kuṭhārī jāyate mukhe |
target_text: For with the birth of a man an axe is born in his mouth,

input_text: yāya chindati āttānaṃ vācaṃ dubbhāṣitaṃ bhaṇaṃ ||
target_text: with which he cuts himself speaking a word that is badly spoken.

input_text: yo hi nindiye praśaṃsati uttavā nindati yo praśaṃsiye |
target_text: He who praises the blameworthy, or he who blames the praiseworthy,

input_text: na paresaṃ vilomāni na paresaṃ katā ’kataṃ |
target_text: Not the wrongs of others, or what others have done or have not done

input_text: āttanā ye aveccheyā katāni akatāni ca ||
target_text: one should consider, but what has been done and not done by oneself.

input_text: na paresaṃ vilomāni na paresaṃ samāsamaṃ |
target_text: Not the wrongs of others, or what is just and unjust for others

input_text: āttanā ye aveccheyā samāni viṣamāṇi ca ||
target_text: one should consider, but what is just and unjust for oneself.

input_text: āttānañ ce priyaṃ ñāyyā rakkheyā naṃ surakkhitaṃ |
target_text: If one regards oneself as dear one should guard oneself right well,

input_text: na etaṃ sulabhaṃ hoti sukhaṃ dukkatakāriṇāṃ ||
target_text: for happiness is not easy to gain by those who do wrong.

input_text: ttiṇṇam añataraṃ yāmānaṃ paṭijāggreya paṇḍito ||
target_text: during one of the three watches of the night the wise one should stay alert.

input_text: ekāsanaṃ ekaśeyaṃ ekacariyām atandrito |
target_text: Sitting alone, lying down alone, walking alone, diligent,

input_text: eko ramayam āttānaṃ vanānte ramitā siyā ||
target_text: the solitary one who delights in himself will delight in the edge of a forest.

input_text: yo śāsanaṃ arahatāṃ ayirāṇāṃ dhammajīvināṃ |
target_text: Whoever reviles the worthy teaching of the Noble Ones who live by Dhamma,

input_text: paṭikrośati dummedho dṛṣṭiṃ niśśāya pāpikāṃ |
target_text: that stupid one, depending on wicked views,

input_text: phalāni kaṇṭakasseva āttaghannāya phallati ||
target_text: like the bamboo when it bears fruit, brings about his own destruction.

input_text: āttānam eva paṭhamaṃ atthe dhaṃme niveśaye |
target_text: First one should establish oneself in the good and the Dhamma,

input_text: athāṃñam anuśāseyā evaṃ hohi yathā ahaṃ ||
target_text: then one can advise another, saying: ‘You must be as I am’.

input_text: āttānam eva paṭhamaṃ paṭirūpe niyojaye |
target_text: First one should commit oneself to what is suitable,

input_text: athāṃñam anuśāsanto na kiliśśati praṃñavā ||
target_text: then when advising another, the wise one should not have any defilement.

input_text: āttanā ye tathā kayirā yathāṃñam anuśāsaye |
target_text: He should do himself as he would advise another to do,

input_text: adānto vata dameyā āttā hi kira duddamo ||
target_text: being untrained, he should surely train himself, for it is said the self is difficult to train.

input_text: āttā hi bhe varaṃ dānto yacchāyam itarā prajā |
target_text: A tamed self is better than that of other people,

input_text: āttadāntassa poṣassa sadā saṃyyatacāriṇo ||
target_text: for the person who conquers himself, who lives always well-restrained,

input_text: neva devā na gandhabbā na māro saha brahmuṇā |
target_text: neither gods, nor gandhabbas, nor Māra together with Brahmās,

input_text: jitaṃ apajitaṃ kayirā tattharūpassa jantuno ||
target_text: can turn conquest into defeat for a person who is like this.

input_text: āttā hi āttano nātho ko hi nātho paro siyā |
target_text: For the self is the friend of self, for what other friend would there be?

input_text: āttanā hi sucinnena nāthaṃ labhati dullabhaṃ ||
target_text: When the self is well-practiced, one finds a friend that is hard to find.

input_text: āttā hi āttano nātho āttā hi āttano gatī |
target_text: Self is the protector of self, self is the refuge of self,

input_text: tassā saṃyyamayā ’ttānaṃ aśśaṃ bhadraṃ va vāṇijo ||
target_text: therefore one should restrain oneself, as a merchant restrains his noble horse.

input_text: āttānam eva damaye aśśasugatiyā sadā |
target_text: One should tame oneself always, that will be for a good destiny,

input_text: daṃma śaṃma ujjuṃ hohi tato akuṭilo bhava ||
target_text: be tamed, be peaceful, be upright, and from that be honest,

input_text: tato dānto sukhī hohi anupādāya nivṛto |
target_text: then, tamed, be happy, unattached and cooled down.

input_text: āttanā codayā ’ttānaṃ parimaśāttānam āttanā |
target_text: By oneself one should censure self, by oneself one should be controlled,

input_text: so āttagutto satimā sukhaṃ bhikkhū vihāhisi |
target_text: he who guards himself, mindful, will live happily, monastic.

input_text: āttadātthaṃ parātthena bahunā pi na hāpaye |
target_text: One should not neglect one’s own good for another’s, however great;

input_text: āttadātthaṃ paraṃ ñāttā sadātthaparamo siyā ||
target_text: knowing further what is good for oneself should be the supreme good.

input_text: nevāttaheto na parassa heto na saggam icche na dhanaṃ na rāṣṭaṃ |
target_text: Not for one’s own sake and not for another’s sake, not desiring heaven, riches, or a kingdom—

input_text: necche adhammeṇa samṛddhim āttano so śīlavā praṃñavā dhāṃmiko siyā ||
target_text: he should not desire his success through corruption; he should be both virtuous and wise and righteous.

input_text: āttavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Self

input_text: napuṣpagandho paṭivātam eti na candanaṃ tagaraṃ vāhlikaṃ vā |
target_text: The fragrance of flowers goes not against the wind, nor does sandalwood or pinwheel or saffron,

input_text: satān tu gandho paṭivātam eti sabbā diśā sappuruṣo pravāti ||
target_text: but the fragrance of the good goes against the wind, the true person’s fragrance permeates all directions.

input_text: candanaṃ tagaraṃ cāpi uppalaṃ atha vāśśikiṃ |
target_text: Sandalwood, pinwheel, then water lily and striped jasmine,

input_text: etesāṃ gandhajātānāṃ śīlagandho anuttaro ||
target_text: amongst these kinds of fragrance virtue’s fragrance is unsurpassed.

input_text: appāmātro ayaṃ gaṃdho yoyaṃ tagaracandane |
target_text: Pinwheel and sandalwood fragrance are insignificant,

input_text: yo tu śīlavatāṃ gandho vāti devesu uttamo ||
target_text: but the fragrance of those who have virtue flutters supreme amongst the gods.

input_text: tesāṃ sampannaśīlānāṃ apramādavihāriṇāṃ |
target_text: Māra cannot find the path of those endowed with virtue, who live heedfully,

input_text: sammadaṃñāvimuttānāṃ māro māggaṃ na viṇḍati ||
target_text: and who are freed through right and deep knowledge.

input_text: yathā pi ruciraṃ puṣpaṃ vannavantaṃ agandhakaṃ |
target_text: Just like a beautiful flower, which has colour, but lacks fragrance,

input_text: evaṃ subhāṣitā vācā aphalā hoti akurvvato ||
target_text: so are well-spoken words fruitless for the one who acts not on them.

input_text: yathā pi ruciraṃ puṣpaṃ vannavantaṃ sagaṃdhakaṃ |
target_text: Just like a beautiful flower, which has colour, and has fragrance,

input_text: evaṃ subhāṣitā vācā saphalā hoti kurvvato ||
target_text: so are well-spoken words fruitful for the one who does act on them.

input_text: yathā pi bhramaro puṣpā vannagandham aheḍayaṃ |
target_text: Just as a bee, without hurting the flower, its colour or scent,

input_text: praḍeti rasam ādāya evaṃ ggrāme munī care ||
target_text: gathers its nectar and escapes, so should the seer roam in the village.

input_text: puṣpāṇi heva pracinantaṃ vyāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ |
target_text: Death takes up and carries away the one whose mind is attached to collecting flowers,

input_text: suttaṃ ggrāmaṃ mahogho vā maccu-r-ādāya gacchati ||
target_text: like a great flood carries off a sleeping village.

input_text: puṣpāṇi heva pracinantaṃ vyāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ |
target_text: The End-Maker takes control of the one whose mind is attached to collecting flowers,

input_text: asaṃpunnesu kāmesu antako kurute vaśe ||
target_text: though he is unfulfilled with sense pleasures.

input_text: yathā pi puṣparāśimhā kayirā mālāguṇe bahū |
target_text: Just as from a heap of flowers one might make a lot of garlands,

input_text: evaṃ jātena māccena kātavvaṃ kuśalaṃ bahuṃ |
target_text: so should many good deeds be done by one who is born a mortal.

input_text: ko imaṃ paṭhaviṃ vijehiti yamalokaṃ va imaṃ sadevakaṃ |
target_text: Who will conquer this earth and the lower realm, together with the gods?

input_text: ko dhammapade sudeśite kuśalo puṣpam iva prajehiti |
target_text: Who will win the well-taught verses of Dhamma as a good man wins a flower?

input_text: śekho paṭhaviṃ vijehiti yamalokaṃ va imaṃ sadevakaṃ |
target_text: The trainee will conquer this earth and the lower realm, together with the gods.

input_text: so dhammapade sudeśite kuśalo puṣpam iva prajehiti ||
target_text: He will win the well-taught verses of Dhamma as a good man wins a flower.

input_text: vāśśikī-r-iva puṣpāṇi mañcakāni pramuñcati |
target_text: Just as striped jasmine casts off its (…) flowers,

input_text: evaṃ rāgañ ca doṣañ ca vipramuñcatha bhikkhavo ||
target_text: so, monastics, cast off all passion and hatred.

input_text: phenopamaṃ lokam imaṃ vidittā marīcidhammaṃ abhisaṃbudhānāṃ |
target_text: Knowing that this world is just like froth, it has the nature of a mirage to those who understand,

input_text: chettāna mārassa prapuṣpakāni addaṃśanaṃ maccurājassa gacche ||
target_text: cutting off Māra’s flower-tipped arrows, one should go beyond the King of Death’s sight.

input_text: yathā saṃkārakūṭamhi ujjhitamhi mahāpathe |
target_text: Just as in a forsaken rubbish heap along the highway

input_text: padumaṃ ubbhidaṃ assa śucigandhaṃ manoramaṃ ||
target_text: a lotus might spring forth, with a pure fragrance, delighting the mind,

input_text: evaṃ saṃkārabhūtesu andhabhūte pṛthujjane |
target_text: so amongst the forsaken, the Perfect Sambuddha’s disciple

input_text: atirocanti praṃñāya saṃmāsabuddhasāvakā ||
target_text: outshines the blind and ordinary folk through his wisdom.

input_text: puṣpavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Flowers

input_text: atthesu jātesusukhā sakhāyā puṃñaṃ sukhaṃjīvitasaṃkhayamhi |
target_text: Friends are good whenever need arises, at the break-up of life merit is good,

input_text: toṣṭī sukhā yā itarītarena sabbassa pāpassa sukhaṃ prahāṇaṃ ||
target_text: being content with everything is good, the abandoning of all wickedness is good.

input_text: sukhā mātreatā loke tato petteatā sukhā |
target_text: Respecting one’s mother is good in the world, also respecting one’s father is good,

input_text: śāmannatā sukhā loke tato brāhmannatā sukhā ||
target_text: respecting ascetics is good in the world, also respecting true brahmins is good.

input_text: sukhaṃ yāvaj jarā śīlaṃ sukhā śraddhā pratiṣṭhitā |
target_text: Virtuous conduct till old age is good, the establishing of faith is good,

input_text: sukhā attharasā vācā assiṃ mānakkhayo sukho ||
target_text: speech that is beneficial is good, the destruction of conceit is good.

input_text: sukho buddhāna uppādo sukhā dhammassa deśanā |
target_text: The arising of the Buddhas is good, the teaching of the Dhamma is good,

input_text: sukhā saṃghassa sāmaggrī samaggrāṇāṃ tapo sukho ||
target_text: the harmony of the Saṅgha is good, devotion to harmony is good.

input_text: sukhaṃ daṃśanam ayirāṇāṃ saṃvāso pi satāṃ sukho |
target_text: Meeting with the noble is pleasant, living with good people is pleasant,

input_text: addaṃśanena bālānāṃ niccam eva sukhī siyā ||
target_text: through not meeting foolish people one will constantly be happy.

input_text: bālāsaṅgatacārī hi drīgham addhāna śocati |
target_text: For he who consorts with fools grieves for a long time,

input_text: dukkho bālehi saṃvāso amittehi-r-iva sabbadā |
target_text: dwelling with fools is always suffering as it is with enemies,

input_text: dhīrā tu sukhasaṃvāsā ñātīnaṃ vā samāgamo ||
target_text: the wise ones dwell happily as with an assembly of kin.

input_text: tassā hi dhīraṃ ca bahuśśutañ ca dhoreyaśīlavratamantam ayiraṃ |
target_text: Therefore the firm and the learned, the virtuous, dutiful and noble—

input_text: taṃ tārisaṃ sappuruṣaṃ sumedhaṃ sevetha nakkhattapathe va candramā ||
target_text: follow such a true and intelligent person as the moon follows the course of the stars.

input_text: priyāto jāyate dukkhaṃ priyā śokā priyā bhayaṃ |
target_text: From love there arises grief, with love grief, with love fear,

input_text: priyāto vipramuttassa nāsti śokā kato bhayaṃ ||
target_text: for one who is free from love there is no grief, how is there fear?

input_text: mā priyehi samāgaṃma apriyehi kadācanaṃ |
target_text: Do not associate at any time with those who are loved or with those unloved,

input_text: priyassa addaṃśanaṃ dukkhaṃ apriyassa ca daṃśanaṃ ||
target_text: there is suffering not meeting the loved one, and suffering from meeting the unloved one.

input_text: tassā priyaṃ na kayirātha priyāvādo hi pāpako |
target_text: Therefore do not hold anything as loved, for speaking of the loved is loathsome.

input_text: ggraṃthā tesaṃ na vijjanti yesaṃ nāsti priyāpriyaṃ ||
target_text: There are no knots for those who hold nothing as loved or as unloved.

input_text: chudhā parama rogāṇāṃ saṃkhāraparamaṃ dukhaṃ |
target_text: Hunger is the supreme sickness, conditions are the supreme suffering,

input_text: etaṃ ñāttā yathābhūtaṃ nibbāṇaparamaṃ sukhaṃ ||
target_text: knowing this as it really is, know Nibbāna is the supreme good.

input_text: āroggaparamā lābhā sāṃtoṣṭīparamaṃ dhanaṃ |
target_text: Health is the supreme gain, content the supreme wealth,

input_text: viśśāsaparamā ñātī nibbāṇaparamaṃ sukhaṃ ||
target_text: confidence the supreme kin, Nibbāna the supreme good.

input_text: māttāsukhapariccāgā paśśe ce vipulāṃ sukhaṃ |
target_text: If, by renouncing a small good, he might see a good that is large,

input_text: caje māttāsukhaṃ dhīro saṃpaśśaṃ vipulāṃ sukham ||
target_text: the wise one should renounce that small good, seeing the good that is extensive.

input_text: manujassa sadā satīmato māttaṃ jāniya laddhibhojane |
target_text: For a human who is always mindful, knowing the measure in food received,

input_text: tanukā ’ssa bhavanti vedanā śanikaṃ jīrati āyu pālayaṃ ||
target_text: his painful feelings become slight, he ages slowly, guarding his lifespan.

input_text: dullabho puruṣājaṃño na so sabbattha jāyati |
target_text: A person of good breed is rare, that one is not born everywhere,

input_text: yattha so jāyate vīro taṃ kulaṃ sukham edhati ||
target_text: wherever that hero is born, that family gains happiness.

input_text: sabbattha ve sappuruṣā bhavanti na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo |
target_text: There are surely true people everywhere, the good do not talk of desiring sense-pleasures;

input_text: sukhena phuṭṭhā uttavā dukhena noccāvacaṃ sappuruṣā karonti ||
target_text: when touched by pleasure or by suffering, true people are not elated or depressed.

input_text: jayaṃ veraṃ prasavati dukkhaṃ śeti parājito |
target_text: The victor generates hatred, the defeated one finds suffering,

input_text: upaśānto sukhaṃ śeti hettā jayaparājayaṃ ||
target_text: the one at peace lives happily, having abandoned victory and defeat.

input_text: sukhā najjo sūpatitthā sukho dhammajito jano |
target_text: Pleasant are rivers with good fords, pleasant is the person conquered by Dhamma,

input_text: sukho śraddhapaṭīlābho pāpassa akaraṇaṃ sukhaṃ ||
target_text: the acquisition of faith is good, doing nothing wicked is good.

input_text: sukhaṃ draṣṭuṃ śīlavanto sukhaṃ draṣṭuṃ bahuśśutā |
target_text: It is pleasant to meet the virtuous, it is pleasant to meet the learned,

input_text: arahanto pi sukhaṃ draṣṭuṃ vipramuttā niropadhī ||
target_text: it is pleasant to meet the Worthy Ones, who are free from attachments.

input_text: atthavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Need

input_text: phandanaṃ capalaṃ cittaṃ durakkhaṃ dunnivārayaṃ |
target_text: An agitated, unsteady mind, difficult to guard, difficult to ward,

input_text: ujjuṃ karoti medhāvī uṣukāro va tejanā ||
target_text: the sagacious one makes straight, as a fletcher does his arrows.

input_text: vārijo va thale khitto okamokātu ubbhato |
target_text: Like a fish thrown up on dry land, pulled out from its watery home,

input_text: pariphandatimaṃ cittaṃ māradheyaṃ prahātaye ||
target_text: the mind is agitated, one ought to throw off the sway of Māra.

input_text: dūraṃgamaṃ ekacaraṃ aśarīraṃ guhāśayaṃ |
target_text: Those who will restrain the mind that roams far,

input_text: ye cittaṃ saṃyyamehinti mokkhaṃte mārabaṃdhanā ||
target_text: is lonesome, without a body, hidden, gain release from the bonds of Māra.

input_text: dunniggrahassa laghuno yatthakāmanipātino |
target_text: For the mind that is difficult to subdue, flighty, flitting wherever it will,

input_text: cittassa damatho sādhu cittaṃ dāntaṃ sukhāvahaṃ ||
target_text: restraint is good, a restrained mind brings happiness.

input_text: sududdaśaṃ sunipuṇaṃ yatthakāmanipātinaṃ |
target_text: Hard to see, very subtle, flitting wherever it will,

input_text: cittaṃ rakkheya medhāvī tadahi guttaṃ sukhāvahaṃ ||
target_text: the sage should guard the mind, for guarded it brings happiness.

input_text: anaprāśrayamāṇassa ananvāhatacetaso |
target_text: For the one with mind that is not dependent, for the one with mind unperplexed,

input_text: hettā kallāṇapāpāni nāsti jāgarato bhayaṃ ||
target_text: having abandoned the wholesome and demerit, for the watchful, there is no fear.

input_text: dhammaprītirasaṃ pāttā viprasannena cetasā |
target_text: The one who drinks the tasty Dhamma drink, with a clear mind,

input_text: ayirapravedite dhamme sadā ramati paṇḍito ||
target_text: the wise one will always delight in the Dhamma that is made known by the Noble.

input_text: acirā vata ayaṃ kāyo paṭhaviṃ abhiśehiti |
target_text: Before long has passed by, alas, this body will lie on the ground,

input_text: chūḍo apetaviṃnyāṇo nirātthaṃ vā kaṭiṃgaraṃ ||
target_text: rejected, without consciousness, just like a useless piece of wood.

input_text: kuṃbhopamaṃ kāyam imaṃ vidittā nagaropamaṃ cittam adhiṣṭhihittā |
target_text: Knowing this body is frail like a jar, govern the mind like a fortress,

input_text: yodheya māraṃ praṃñāyudhena jitaṃ ca rakkhe aniveśano siyā ||
target_text: one should fight Māra with the weapon of wisdom, guard your success, and do not be attached.

input_text: yathā agāraṃ ducchannaṃ vaṭṭhī samitivijjhati |
target_text: Just as the rain penetrates a house with thatching that is poor,

input_text: evaṃ abhāvitaṃ cittaṃ rāgo samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so passion penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.

input_text: yathā agāraṃ succhannaṃ vaṭṭhī na samitivijjhati |
target_text: Just as rain does not penetrate a house with thatching that is good,

input_text: evaṃ subhāvitaṃ cittaṃ rāgo na samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so passion cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.

input_text: evaṃ abhāvitaṃ cittaṃ doṣo samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so hatred penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.

input_text: evaṃ subhāvitaṃ cittaṃ doṣo na samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so hatred cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.

input_text: evaṃ abhāvitaṃ cittaṃ moho samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so delusion penetrates a mind that is undeveloped.

input_text: evaṃ subhāvitaṃ cittaṃ moho na samitivijjhati ||
target_text: so delusion cannot penetrate a mind that is well-developed.

input_text: sabbapāpassa akaraṇaṃ kuśalassa apasaṃpadā |
target_text: The non-doing of anything wicked, undertaking of what is good,

input_text: sacittapariyodamanaṃ etaṃ buddhāna śāsanaṃ ||
target_text: the training of one’s mind—this is the teaching of the Buddhas.

input_text: cittavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about the Mind

input_text: 21. sahasra
target_text: 21. The Chapter about Thousands

input_text: sahasram api ce vācā anatthapadasāhitā |
target_text: Though there are a thousand sayings consisting of useless words,

input_text: ekaṃ atthapadaṃ śreyo yaṃ śottā upaśāṃmati ||
target_text: better is one useful word, hearing which one is brought to peace.

input_text: yo ca gāthāśataṃ bhāṣe anatthapadasāhitaṃ |
target_text: One may speak a thousand verses consisting of useless words,

input_text: ekaṃ dhamapadaṃ śreyo yaṃ śottā upaśāṃmati ||
target_text: better is one verse of Dhamma, hearing which one is brought to peace.

input_text: yo sahasraṃ sahasrāṇāṃ saṃggrāme mānuṣe jine |
target_text: One may conquer a thousand men a thousand times in a battle,

input_text: ekaṃ ca paṃñam āttānaṃ sa ve saṃggrāmamuttamo ||
target_text: but having conquered another, one’s self, one would surely be supreme in battle.

input_text: māse māse sahasreṇa yo yajeya śataṃ samā |
target_text: One might give alms impartially with a thousand coins of money month by month for a hundred years;

input_text: ekañ ca bhāvitāttānaṃ muhuttam api pūjaye |
target_text: and one might worship someone with developed self for a second—

input_text: sā eva pūjanā śreyo yac cha vaśśaśataṃ hutaṃ ||
target_text: that worship is surely better than the hundred-year sacrifice.

input_text: yo ca vaśśaśataṃ jantū aggiṃ paricare vane |
target_text: One person might care for the fire in the woods for a hundred years;

input_text: yaṃ kiñci yaṣṭaṃ va hutaṃ va loke saṃvatsaraṃ yajate puṃñapekhī |
target_text: Whatever the alms or the sacrifice in the world the one seeking merit may give for a year,

input_text: sabbaṃ pi taṃ na catubbhāgam eti abhivādanā ujjugatesu śreyo ||
target_text: all that comes not to a quarter of the merit—better is the worship of the upright.
