input_text: siddhaṃ namaḥ sarvvabuddhadharmmāryyasaṅghebhyaḥ
target_text: Hail and Homage to all Buddhas, Dharmas and the Noble Saṅghas.

input_text: manopūrvvaṃgamā dhammā manośreṣṭhā manojavā |
target_text: Mind precedes thoughts, mind is their chief, they are impelled by mind,

input_text: manasā ca praduṣṭena bhāṣate vā karoti vā |
target_text: if with a base mind one speaks or acts,

input_text: tato naṃ dukham anneti cakram vā vahato padaṃ ||
target_text: through that, suffering follows him like a wheel follows the ox’s foot.

input_text: manasā ca prasannena bhāṣate vā karoti vā |
target_text: if with pure mind one speaks or acts,

input_text: tato naṃ sukham anneti cchāyā vā anapāyinī ||
target_text: through that, happiness follows him like a shadow which does not depart.

input_text: iha śocati precca śocati pāpakammo ubhayattha śocati |
target_text: Here he laments, after death he laments, the wicked one laments in both places,

input_text: so śocati so vihaṃnyati dṛṣṭā kammakileśam āttano ||
target_text: he laments, he suffers vexation, seeing the defilement of his own deeds.

input_text: iha nandati precca nandati katapuṃño ubhayattha nandati |
target_text: Here he is happy, after death he is happy, the meritorious one is happy in both places,

input_text: so nandati dati dṛṣṭā kammaviśuddhim āttano ||
target_text: he is happy… seeing the purity of his own deeds.

input_text: ākrośi maṃ avadhi maṃ ajini maṃ ahāsi me |
target_text: “He abused me, he struck at me, he overcame me, he robbed me,”

input_text: ye tāni upanahyanti veraṃ tesaṃ na śāmyati ||
target_text: those who bear these ill-will their hatred is never appeased.

input_text: ye tāni nopanahyanti veraṃ tesaṃ upaśāmyati ||
target_text: those who do not bear these ill-will their hatred is appeased.

input_text: śubhā ’nupaśśiṃ viharantaṃ indriyesu asaṃvṛtaṃ |
target_text: Living contemplating what is pleasant, uncontrolled in sense faculties,

input_text: bhojanamhi amāttaṃñū kuśīdaṃ hīnavīriyaṃ ||
target_text: not knowing the limit in food, indolent, low in energy—

input_text: taṃ ve prasahate māro vāto rukkham va dubbalaṃ |
target_text: Māra surely overthrows that one, like wind overthrows a weak tree.

input_text: aśubhānupaśśiṃ viharantaṃ indriyeṣu susaṃvṛtaṃ ||
target_text: Living contemplating the unpleasant, well-controlled in sense faculties,

input_text: bhojanamhi ca māttraṃñū saddhaṃ āraddhavīriyaṃ |
target_text: and knowing the limit in food, faithful, with energy aroused—

input_text: taṃ ve na prasahate māro vāto śelaṃ va parvvataṃ ||
target_text: Māra does not overthrow that one, just as wind does not overthrow a mountain made of rock.

input_text: sace labheyā nipakaṃ sapraṃñaṃ sāddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāradhīraṃ |
target_text: If you should find a prudent, wise companion, one who lives well, a wise one,

input_text: adhibhūya sabbāṇi pariśravāṇi careyā tenāttamano satīmā ||
target_text: overcoming all your troubles you should live with that one, glad and mindful.

input_text: no ce labheyā nipakaṃ sapraṃñaṃ sāddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāradhīraṃ |
target_text: If you do not find a prudent, wise companion, one who lives well, a wise one,

input_text: rājā va rāṣṭaṃ vijitaṃ prahāya eko ccare mātaṃgāranne va nāgo ||
target_text: like a king who abandons his conquered kingdom, one should live alone like a solitary elephant in the forest.

input_text: ekassa caritaṃ śreyo nāsti bāle bitīyatā |
target_text: It is better to live alone, there can be no companionship with a fool,

input_text: eko ccare na ca pāpāni kayirā appussuko mātaṃgāranne va nāgo ||
target_text: one should live alone and not do anything bad, unconcerned like a solitary elephant in the forest.

input_text: chandadoṣabhayā mohā yo dhammaṃ ativattati |
target_text: He who, through desire, hatred, fear or delusion, transgresses Dhamma,

input_text: nīhīrate tassa yaśo kālapakkhe va candramā ||
target_text: his fame diminishes, like the moon in the dark fortnight.

input_text: chandadoṣabhayā mohā yo dhammaṃ nātivattati |
target_text: He who, through desire, hatred, fear or delusion, does not transgress Dhamma,

input_text: āpūrate tassa yaśo śuklapakkhe va candramā ||
target_text: his fame increases, like the moon in the bright fortnight.

input_text: jamavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about the Pairs

input_text: ye keci śokā paridevitaṃ vā dukkhaṃ va lokamhi anekarūpaṃ |
target_text: Whatever griefs or lamentations there are, and the many kinds of suffering in the world,

input_text: priyaṃ paṭicca prabhavanti ete priye asante na bhavanti ete ||
target_text: these all arise because of love, without loves, these do not originate.

input_text: tassā hi te sukhino vītaśokā yesaṃ priyaṃ nāsti kahiṃci loke |
target_text: Therefore they are happy and free from grief, who are without love for anything in the world,

input_text: tassā aśokaṃ virajaṃ prātthayānā priyaṃ na kayirātha kahiṃci loke ||
target_text: therefore those wanting what is griefless, dust-free, should not have love for anything in the world.

input_text: gataddhuno viśokassa vipramuttassa sabbahiṃ |
target_text: For the one who has reached his goal, who grieves not, being released on all sides,

input_text: sabbaggrantaprahīṇassa paridāhā na vijjati ||
target_text: who has abandoned all the knots, no consuming fever is found.

input_text: yesāṃ sannicayo nāsti ye pariñātabhojanā |
target_text: For those who have no stores, those who comprehend food aright,

input_text: ākāśe va śakuntānāṃ padaṃ tesāṃ durannayaṃ ||
target_text: like the birds in the sky, their footprint is hard to find.

input_text: śānto tassa mano hoti śāntā vācā ca kaṃmu ca |
target_text: His mind is calm, his speech and his actions are also calm,

input_text: saṃmadaṃñāvimuttassa upaśāntassa tāyino ||
target_text: liberated by right knowledge, such a one is truly peaceful.

input_text: yassendriyāṇi samathaṃ gatāni aśśā yathā sārathinā sudāntā |
target_text: For the one whose senses are balanced, like horses well-trained by their charioteer,

input_text: prahīṇamānassa anāsavassa devā pi tassa prihayanti tāyino ||
target_text: who has abandoned conceit, who is without pollutants—even the gods envy such a one.

input_text: dāntaṃ nayanti samitiṃ dāntaṃ rājābhirūhati |
target_text: They lead one trained into a crowd, a king mounts one who has been trained,

input_text: dānto śreṣṭho manuṣyesu yo ’tivāde titikkhati ||
target_text: amongst humans one trained is best, the one who can endure reproof.

input_text: varam assatarā dāntā ājāneyā ca sendhavā |
target_text: Noble are the well-trained horses, the well-bred horses from Sindh,

input_text: kuñjarā va mahānāgā āttā dānto tato varaṃ ||
target_text: and the great tusker elephants, and even more noble than that is the one who has trained himself.

input_text: na hi tehi jānajātehi tāṃ bhūmim abhisaṃbhave |
target_text: Not by these vehicles can one reach that place,

input_text: yathā ’ttanā sudāntena dānto dāntena gacchati ||
target_text: as one through training himself well, being trained by the training, goes.

input_text: śelo yathā ekaghano vātena na samīrati |
target_text: Just as solid rock is not shaken by the wind,

input_text: evaṃ nindāpraśaṃsāsu na samīranti paṇḍitā ||
target_text: so the wise are not shaken by blame or praise.

input_text: anikkaṣāyo kāṣāyaṃ yo vastaṃ paridhehiti |
target_text: The one who, while still impure, would wear the renunciant’s robe,

input_text: apeto damasaccena na so kāṣāyam arihati ||
target_text: unendowed with restraint and truth, is not worthy of the renunciant’s robe.

input_text: yo tu vāntakaṣāyassa śīlehi susamāhito |
target_text: The one who, steady in virtue, throws out any impurity,

input_text: upeto damasaccena sa ve kāṣāyam arihati ||
target_text: endowed with restraint and truth, is indeed worthy of the renunciant’s robe.

input_text: śokavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Grief

input_text: manujassa pramattacāriṇo tahnāvaddhatimālutā iva |
target_text: For a human who lives life heedlessly craving increases like a clinging creeper,

input_text: sā prāplavate hurāhuraṃ phalameṣī va vanamhi vānnaro ||
target_text: he rushes from one place to another like a monkey seeking fruit in the forest.

input_text: yaṃ cesā sahate jaṃmī tahnā loke duraccayā |
target_text: That one who is overcome by these low cravings in the world, which are difficult to get past,

input_text: śokā tassa pravaddhaṃti ovaṭṭhā beruṇā iva ||
target_text: for him griefs increase like grass that has been rained upon.

input_text: yo cetāṃ sahate jaṃmiṃ tahnāṃ loke duraccayāṃ |
target_text: Whoever overcomes this low craving in the world, which is difficult to get past,

input_text: śokā tassa vivaṭṭanti udabindū va pukkhare ||
target_text: griefs roll from him like a drop of water on a lotus.

input_text: taṃ vo vademi bhadraṃ vo yāvaṃt-ittha samāgatā |
target_text: This I say to you: “Good luck to as many as have assembled here”,

input_text: tahnāṃ samūlāṃ khaṇatha uṣīrātthī va beruṇiṃ |
target_text: dig up the root of craving, like one seeking the root digs up grass,

input_text: tahnāya khatamūlāya nāsti śokā kato bhayaṃ ||
target_text: for one who has cut off the root of craving there are no griefs, how is there fear?

input_text: tahnabitiyo puruṣo drīgham addhāna saṃsari |
target_text: A man with craving as companion has a long time in births-and-deaths,

input_text: etthabhāvaṃñathābhāvaṃ tattha tattha punappuno ||
target_text: in this existence or another existence, here and there, again and again.

input_text: etam ādīnavaṃ nyāttā tahnā dukkhassa saṃbhavaṃ |
target_text: Having understood the danger, that craving is the origination of suffering,

input_text: vītatahno anādāno sato bhikkhū parivraje ||
target_text: free from craving, without attachment, the monastic should wander mindfully.

input_text: na taṃ dṛḍhaṃ bandhanam āhu dhīrā yad āyasaṃ dārujaṃ babbajaṃ vā |
target_text: That bondage is not so strong say the wise, that is made of iron or wood or reeds,

input_text: sārattarattā maṇikuṇḍalesu putresu dāresu ca yā apekhā ||
target_text: impassioned and excited they seek out jewels and earrings and children and wives—

input_text: etaṃ dṛḍhaṃ bandhanam āhu dhīrā ohārimaṃ sukhumaṃ dupramuñcaṃ |
target_text: that bondage is strong say the wise, dragging down, subtle, hard to get free from,

input_text: etappi chettāna vrajanti santo anapekhino sabbadukhaṃ prahāya ||
target_text: having cut this down the good go peacefully seeking nothing, abandoning all suffering.

input_text: na kāhāpaṇavāsena ttrettī kāmesu vijjati |
target_text: Not through a rain of coins is satisfaction found for sense desires,

input_text: appāssādā dukhā kāmā iti viṃñāya paṇḍito ||
target_text: the wise one knowing: “Sense pleasures have little joy, much suffering,”

input_text: api divvesu kāmesu ratiṃ so nādhigacchati ||
target_text: does not find delight even in heavenly pleasures.

input_text: tahnakkhayarato hoti saṃmasaṃbuddhasāvako ||
target_text: The disciple of the Perfect Sambuddha delights in craving’s destruction.

input_text: vītatahno anādāno niruttīpadakovido |
target_text: Without craving, without attachment, skilled in words and their explanation,

input_text: akkharāṇāṃ sannipātena ñāyyā pūrvvāparāṇi so |
target_text: knowing how syllables are arranged, which come before and which after,

input_text: sa ve antimaśārīro mahāpraṃño ti vuccati ||
target_text: the one in his final body is said to be one of great wisdom.

input_text: saritāni sinehitāni ca somanassāni bhavanti jantuno |
target_text: There are flowing streams of affection and mental happinesses for a person,

input_text: ye sātasitā sukheṣiṇo te ve jātijaropagā ||
target_text: pleasure-dependent they seek happiness, those people undergo birth and old age.

input_text: tahnāya purekkhaṭā prajā parisappanti śaśo va bādhito |
target_text: People surrounded by craving crawl round like a hare in a trap,

input_text: te saṃjotanasaṅgasattā gabbham upenti punappuno ciraṃ pi ||
target_text: they are attached and clinging to fetters, they come back again and again to the womb for a long time.

input_text: muñca pure muñca pacchato majjhe muñca bhavassa pāragū |
target_text: Be free of the past, be free of the future, be free of the present, after crossing over all existence,

input_text: sabbattha vimuttamānaso na puno jātijarām upehisi ||
target_text: with mind liberated in every way, you will not return to birth and old age.

input_text: yo nivvanadho vanā tu mutto vanamutto vanam eva dhāvati |
target_text: The one who is free from desires, who is free in the forest, though free from the forest, runs back to the forest,

input_text: taṃ puggalam etha paśśatha mutto bandhanam eva dhāvati ||
target_text: come here and look at that person, though free, he runs back to bondage.

input_text: ttriṇadoṣāṇi khettrāṇi rāgadoṣā ayaṃ prajā |
target_text: Fields are ruined by grassy weeds, these people are ruined by passion,

input_text: tassā hi vītarāgesu dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ ||
target_text: therefore there is great fruit for that given to those without passion.

input_text: ttriṇadoṣāṇi khettrāṇi doṣadoṣā ayaṃ prajā |
target_text: Fields are ruined by grassy weeds, these people are ruined by hatred,

input_text: tassā hi vītadoṣesu dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ ||
target_text: therefore there is great fruit for that given to those without hatred.

input_text: ttriṇadoṣāṇi khettrāṇi mohadoṣā ayaṃ prajā |
target_text: Fields are ruined by grassy weeds, these people are ruined by delusion,

input_text: tassā hi vītamohesu dinnaṃ hoti mahapphalaṃ ||
target_text: therefore there is great fruit for that given to those without delusion.

input_text: ramaṇīyaṃ vatā ’raṇṇaṃ yamhiṃ na ramate jano |
target_text: The delightful wilderness wherein the people do not delight,

input_text: vītarāgāttha raṃsanti nāṃñe kāmagaveṣiṇo ||
target_text: those without passion delight therein, but not those who seek sense pleasures.

input_text: yathā pi mūle anupadrute dṛḍhe chinno pi rukkho punar-īva jāyati |
target_text: Just as when the root remains firm and undamaged though the tree was cut down, it springs up again,

input_text: em eva tahnānuśaye anūhate nivvattate dukkham idaṃ punappuno ||
target_text: so when the tendency to craving is not rooted out this suffering appears again and again.

input_text: tahnavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Craving

input_text: 2. apramāda
target_text: 2. The Chapter about Heedfulness

input_text: apramādo amatapadaṃ pramādo maccuno padaṃ |
target_text: Heedfulness is the deathless state, heedlessness the state of the dead,

input_text: apramattā na mrīyanti ye pramattā yathā matā ||
target_text: the heedful do not die, but those who are heedless are as if dead.

input_text: etaṃ viśeṣataṃ nyāttā apramādamhi paṇḍitā |
target_text: The wise, understanding this difference in regard to heedfulness,

input_text: apramāde pramodanti ayirāṇāṃ gocare ratā ||
target_text: rejoice in heedfulness, delight in the domain of the Noble Ones.

input_text: te jhāyino sātatikā niccaṃ dṛḍhaparākramā |
target_text: Those who meditate all the time, constant and firm in their effort,

input_text: phusanti dhīrā nibbāṇaṃ yogacchemaṃ anuttaraṃ ||
target_text: those wise ones reach Nibbāna, the unsurpassed release from all bonds.

input_text: pramādam anuyuñjanti bālā dummedhino janā |
target_text: The foolish and stupid people cultivate heedlessness,

input_text: apramādan tu medhāvī dhanaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ va rakkhati ||
target_text: but the sagacious one guards heedfulness just as his greatest wealth.

input_text: apramatto pramattesu suttesu bahujāgaro |
target_text: Heedful amongst the heedless ones, wakeful amongst the ones who sleep,

input_text: abalāśśam va śīghrāśśo hettā yāti sumedhaso ||
target_text: like a swift horse who abandons a weak horse, the true sage moves on.

input_text: pramādam apramādena yadā nudati paṇḍito |
target_text: When the wise one eliminates heedlessness with his heedfulness,

input_text: praṃñāprāsādam āruyha aśoko śokiniṃ prajāṃ |
target_text: and mounts the palace of wisdom, griefless, he looks on grieving people;

input_text: parvvataṭṭho va bhoma ’ṭṭhe dhīro bāle avecchati ||
target_text: the wise one, like one standing on a mountain, looks down on the fools who are standing on the plains.

input_text: pūrvve cāpi pramajjittā yo pacchā na pramajjati |
target_text: Whoever before was heedless, but later is not heedless,

input_text: so imaṃ lokaṃ prabhāseti abhramutto va candramā ||
target_text: that one shines brightly in this world like the moon released from a cloud.

input_text: so imāṃ visattikāṃ loke sato samativattati ||
target_text: he, being mindful, can overcome clinging to the world.

input_text: apramādagaru bhikkhū pramāde bhayadaṃśino |
target_text: A monastic who values heedfulness, seeing danger in heedlessness,

input_text: abhavvo parihāṇāya nibbāṇasseva santike ||
target_text: is unable to fall away: he is well-nigh to Nibbāna.

input_text: saṃyojanam aṇutthūlaṃ dahaṃ aggīva gacchati |
target_text: advances like burning fire against the fetter, small or large.

input_text: apramādaratā hotha saṃ cittam anurakkhatha ||
target_text: You should delight in heedfulness, you should always protect your mind,

input_text: duggā uddharathāttānaṃ pake sanno va kuñjaro |
target_text: you should raise yourself from this pit like the tusker sunk in the mud.

input_text: apramāde pramudino nipakā śīlasaṃvṛtā ||
target_text: Rejoicing in heedfulness, prudent, restrained in virtue,

input_text: te ve kālena prācchanti yattha prātto na śocati |
target_text: in good time they attain that where, once attained, there is no grieving.

input_text: mā pramāde pramodetha na kāmaratisandhave ||
target_text: Do not rejoice in heedlessness, unacquainted with delight in sensual pleasure,

input_text: evaṃ viharan ātāpī śāntacitto ’nuddhato |
target_text: living in this way, ardent, with mind at peace, not proud,

input_text: cetośamatham anuyutto dukkhassantakaro siyā ||
target_text: devoted to mental calm, he will make an end to suffering.

input_text: uṭṭheyā na pramajjeyā dhammaṃ sucaritaṃ care |
target_text: One should strive, not be heedless, one should live by Dhamma, with good conduct,

input_text: dhammacārī sukhaṃ śeti aśśiṃ loke paramhi ca ||
target_text: living by Dhamma one lives at ease in this world and the next.

input_text: uṭṭhāṇavato satīmato śucikammassa niśāmmakāriṇo |
target_text: For he who is active, mindful, pure in deeds, considerate,

input_text: saṃyyatassa ca dhammajīvino apramattassa yaśo ’ssa vaddhati ||
target_text: self-controlled, living by Dhamma, heedful, his fame increases.

input_text: uṭṭhāṇenā ’pramādena saṃyyamena damena ca |
target_text: Through activity, heedfulness, through self-control and through restraint,

input_text: dīpaṃ kayirātha medhāvī yam ogho nādhipūrati ||
target_text: the sage should make an island that no flood waters can overwhelm.

input_text: uṭṭhāṇakālamhi anuṭṭhihāno yuvā balī ālasiko upoko |
target_text: The one who has not energy at a time for energy, youthful, strong, lazy in his home,

input_text: saṃsannasaṃkappamano kusīdo praṃñāya māggaṃ alaso na yeti ||
target_text: whose mind lacks right intention and is indolent—the lazy one does not go along wisdom’s path.

input_text: hīnaṃ dhammaṃ na seveyā pramādena na samvase |
target_text: One should not follow lowly things, one should not abide heedlessly,

input_text: micchadṛṣṭiṃ na seveyā na siyā lokavaddhano ||
target_text: one should not follow a wrong view, one should not foster worldliness.

input_text: na tāvatā dhammadharo yāvatā bahu bhāṣati |
target_text: One is not a Dhamma-bearer merely through speaking much,

input_text: yo tu appam pi sottāna dhammaṃ kāyena phassaye |
target_text: but the one who, having heard a little, would see Dhamma for himself,

input_text: sa ve dhammadharo hoti yo dhamme na pramajjati ||
target_text: is one who bears Dhamma, the one who is not heedless regarding Dhamma.

input_text: dhammaṃ vicinātha apramattā mā vo kāmaguṇā bhrameṃsu cittaṃ |
target_text: Consider the Dhamma heedfully, do not let your mind swirl around in strands of desire,

input_text: mā lohaguḍe gilaṃ pramatto kraṇḍe dukkham idan ti dayhamāno ||
target_text: do not, heedless, swallow a hot iron ball, and, while burning, cry: ‘This is suffering.’

input_text: apramādavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Heedfulness

input_text: bahū veśaraṇaṃ yānti parvvate ca vanāni ca |
target_text: Many people shaken by fear go for refuge

input_text: vastūni rukkhacittāṇi manuṣyā bhayatajjitā ||
target_text: to mountains and woods, to places with beautiful trees.

input_text: na etaṃ śaraṇaṃ khemmaṃ na etaṃ śaraṇam uttamaṃ |
target_text: That is not a secure refuge, that is not the refuge supreme,

input_text: etaṃ śaraṇam āgaṃma sabbadukkhā pramuccati ||
target_text: nor is it the refuge to come to that liberates from all suffering.

input_text: yo tu buddhañ ca dhammañ ca saghaṃ ca śaraṇaṃ gato |
target_text: Whoever has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the Dhamma and the Saṅgha,

input_text: cattāri ca ariyasaccāni yathābhūtāni paśśati ||
target_text: and who sees as it really is the four noble truths.

input_text: etaṃ ve śaraṇaṃ khemmaṃ etaṃ śaraṇam uttamaṃ |
target_text: That is a secure refuge, that is the refuge supreme,

input_text: etaṃ śaraṇam āgamma sabbadukkhā pramuccati ||
target_text: that is the refuge to come to that liberates from all suffering.

input_text: gavāṃ ce taramāṇānāṃ jihmaṃ gacchati puṅgavo |
target_text: If, when cows are crossing a road, their leader goes crookedly,

input_text: sabbā tā jihmaṃ gacchaṃti nette jihmagate sati ||
target_text: they all will go crookedly, as their guide crookedly does go.

input_text: evām eva manuṣyesu yo hoti śreṣṭhasaṃmato |
target_text: So it is with humans, he who is agreed upon as chief,

input_text: sa ce adhaṃmaṃ carati prāg eva itarā prajā ||
target_text: if he lives unrighteously, so will other people.

input_text: gavāṃ ce taramāṇānāṃ ujjuṃ gacchati puṅgavo |
target_text: If, when cows are crossing a road, their leader goes straight,

input_text: sabbā tā ujjuṃ gacchaṃti nette ujjugate sati ||
target_text: they all will go straight, as their guide straight does go;

input_text: evām eva manuṣyesu yo hoti śreṣṭhasaṃmato |
target_text: so it is with humans, he who is agreed upon as chief,

input_text: sa ce va dhaṃmaṃ carati prāg eva itarā prajā ||
target_text: if he lives righteously, so will other people.

input_text: dhaṃmaṃ care sucaritaṃ na naṃ duccaritaṃ care |
target_text: One should live by Dhamma, with good conduct, not with bad conduct,

input_text: brahmacārī sukhaṃ śeti assiṃ loke paramhi ca ||
target_text: living the holy life one lives at ease in this world and the next.

input_text: dhaṃmārāmo dhaṃmarato dhaṃmaṃ anuvicintayaṃ |
target_text: The one who finds pleasure in the Dhamma, delights in Dhamma, reflects on Dhamma,

input_text: dhammaṃ anussaraṃ bhikkhū dhammā na parihāyati ||
target_text: the monastic who remembers Dhamma, does not abandon the Dhamma.

input_text: dhammo have rakkhati dhammacārī dhammo sucinno sukhāya dahāti |
target_text: The Dhamma protects the one who lives by the Dhamma, the Dhamma well-practised is set on happiness,

input_text: esānuśaṃso dhamme sucinne na doggatiṃ gacchati dhammacārī ||
target_text: this is the advantage of the Dhamma well-practised, he who lives by the Dhamma does not go to a bad destination.

input_text: dhammo have rakkhati brahmacārī dhammo sucinno sukhāya dahāti |
target_text: The Dhamma protects the one who lives by the holy life, the Dhamma well-practised is set on happiness,

input_text: esā ’nuśaṃso dhamme sucinne na doggatiṃ gacchati brahmacārī ||
target_text: this is the advantage of the Dhamma well-practised, he who lives the holy life does not go to a bad destination.

input_text: acarittā brahmaceraṃ aladdhā yovvane dhanaṃ |
target_text: Not having lived the holy life, not having gained wealth in their youth,

input_text: jinnakroṃcā va jhāyaṃti jhīnamacche va pallare ||
target_text: they waste away like herons in a small lake devoid of fish.

input_text: śenti cāpādhikinno vā porāṇāni a ’nutthunaṃ ||
target_text: they lie like shafts scattered from a bow, wailing about things in the past.

input_text: ujjujjanti satīmanto na nikete ramaṃti te |
target_text: The mindful ones who are striving do not delight in a dwelling,

input_text: haṃsā va pallaraṃ hettā okam okaṃ jahaṃti te ||
target_text: like geese who abandon a lake, they abandon fondness for homes.

input_text: haṃsā va ādiccapathe vehāyasaṃ yānti iddhiyā |
target_text: As geese go through the path of the sky, they go through the sky by their power,

input_text: niyyāṃti dhīrā lokamhi mārasenaṃ pramaddiya ||
target_text: the wise are led out in the world, after crushing Māra and his army.

input_text: kin nu hāśo kim ānando niccaṃ prajjalite sati |
target_text: Why this laughter, why this joy, when the world is constantly burning,

input_text: andhakāramhi prakkhittā pradīpaṃ na gaveṣatha ||
target_text: when thrown into darkness, do you not seek for a light?

input_text: praccaṃtimaṃ vā nagaraṃ guttaṃ sāntarabāhiraṃ |
target_text: As a town in the border districts is guarded on the inside and the outside,

input_text: evaṃ rakkhatha āttānaṃ khaṇo vo mā upaccagū |
target_text: so one should protect oneself, and you should not let the moment pass,

input_text: na muṇḍabhāvā śamaṇo avrato alikaṃ bhaṇaṃ |
target_text: Not through being shaven is one an ascetic, if one lacks vows, speaks lies,

input_text: icchālobhasamāpanno śamaṇo kiṃ bhaviṣyati ||
target_text: and is endowed with greed and desire, how will one be an ascetic?

input_text: yo tu śameti pāpāni aṇutthūlāni sabbaśo |
target_text: The one who quenches wicked deeds, small and great, in every way—

input_text: śamaṇā eva pāpānāṃ śamaṇo ti pravuccati ||
target_text: through the appeasing of wicked deeds he is said to be an ascetic.

input_text: yassa chattrīśatiṃ sotā mānāphassamayā bhriśā |
target_text: For the one in whom thirty-six streams consisting of contact with conceit are strong,

input_text: vāhā vahanti dudriṣṭiṃ saṃkappā ggredhaniśśitā ||
target_text: the one with wrong view is carried off by the flow of his greedy intentions.

input_text: krodhaṃ jahe viprajaheya mānaṃ saṃyojanaṃ sabbam atikrameyā |
target_text: One should abandon anger, one should abandon conceit, one should overcome every fetter,

input_text: taṃ nāmarūpamhi asajjamānaṃ akiṃcanaṃ nānupatanti dukkhā ||
target_text: without clinging to mind and bodily form, sufferings never do befall the one having no possessions.

input_text: śaraṇavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Refuge

input_text: appakātemanuṣyesu ye janāpāragāmino |
target_text: Amongst humans few people go beyond,

input_text: athāyam itarā prajā tīram evānudhāvati ||
target_text: the rest of the people run down the bank,

input_text: ye ca kho saṃmadākkhāte dhamme dhaṃmānuvattino |
target_text: but those who live righteously, conforming with this well-taught Dhamma,

input_text: te janā pāram ehiṃti maccudheyaṃ suduttaraṃ ||
target_text: those folk will go beyond the realm of death, which is very hard to cross.

input_text: kihne dhamme viprahāya śukre bhāvetha paṇḍitā |
target_text: Having abandoned the dark state, the wise ones should develop the bright,

input_text: okā anokam āgaṃma viveko yattha dūramaṃ ||
target_text: having gone forth to homelessness from home; in solitude, where it is hard to delight,

input_text: tatthābhiratim eṣāṇā hettā kāme akiṃcanā |
target_text: one should seek to delight in that place, having given up sense pleasures, and having no possessions,

input_text: payirodametha āttānaṃ cittaṃ kileśehi sabbaśo ||
target_text: he should purify the self of defilements of mind in every way.

input_text: yassa saṃbodhiaṃgehi samaṃ cittaṃ subhāvitaṃ |
target_text: For he who has well developed with peaceful mind the factors of complete awakening,

input_text: āttānapaṭinissagge anupādāya ye ratā |
target_text: having given up the self, those who delight in being unattached,

input_text: khīṇāsavā jutīmanto te loke parinivṛtā ||
target_text: pollutant-free, shining forth, are emancipated in the world.

input_text: yadahi kiccaṃ tad apaviddhaṃ akiccaṃ puna kīrati |
target_text: That to be done is rejected, but what is not to be done is done,

input_text: unnaddhānāṃ pramattānāṃ tesaṃ vaddhaṃti āsavā ||
target_text: for the insolent, the heedless, their pollutants increase.

input_text: yesaṃ ca susamāraddhā niccaṃ kāyagatā satī |
target_text: But for those who always properly undertake mindfulness of the body

input_text: akiccaṃ te na sevaṃti kicce sātaccakāriṇo |
target_text: who do not practice what is not to be done, persisting in what is to be done,

input_text: satānāṃ samprajānānāṃ tesaṃ khīyaṃti āsavā ||
target_text: for those mindful ones, those fully aware, their pollutants are destroyed.

input_text: paravajjānupaśśīnāṃ niccaṃ ojjhāyasaṃñinā |
target_text: Those who look for others’ fault, who constantly perceive offence,

input_text: āsavā tesaṃ vaddhanti ārā te āsavakkhayā ||
target_text: for them the pollutants increase, they are far from their destruction.

input_text: jāgarikām anuyuttānāṃ ahorāttānuśikkhiṇāṃ |
target_text: For those devoted to being alert, who train both by day and by night,

input_text: nibbāṇe adhimuttānāṃ atthaṃ gacchaṃti āsavā ||
target_text: who are intent on Nibbāna, the pollutants are laid to rest.

input_text: yesā ’savā parikkhīṇā āhāre ca aniśśitā |
target_text: For those whose pollutants are destroyed, who are not dependent on the foods,

input_text: śuṃñatā ānimitto ca vimogho yesa gocaro |
target_text: for those whose resort is the liberation that is empty or signless,

input_text: na hi śīlavrateneva bāhuśoccena vā puna |
target_text: Not even through virtue or vows, or again through great learning,

input_text: atha vā samādhilābhena vivittaśayanena vā ||
target_text: or through the attainment of concentration, or through a secluded dwelling,

input_text: phusāma nekkhaṃmasukhaṃ apṛthujjanasevitaṃ |
target_text: do we attain the happiness of renunciation, not practised by worldly people;

input_text: bhikkhū viśśāsamāpādi aprāpyāsavakkhayaṃ ||
target_text: let a monastic not be confident as long as the destruction of the pollutants is unattained.

input_text: nāyaṃ pramajjituṃ kālo ’prāpyāsavakkhayaṃ |
target_text: This is not the time to be heedless, while the destruction of the pollutants is unattained,

input_text: pramattaṃ dukham anneti sīhaṃ vā mṛgamātikā |
target_text: heedless he follows suffering, like the mother of deer follows the lion.

input_text: gabbham eke okraṃmanti nirayaṃ pāpakaṃmuṇo |
target_text: Some fall back into the womb, but those who are wicked in the underworld,

input_text: saggaṃ sugatino yānti parinivvānti anāsavā ||
target_text: the righteous go to heaven, those who are pollutant-free are emancipated.

input_text: yathā hrado ’ssa gaṃbhīro viprasanno anāvilo |
target_text: Like a lake that is deep, clear and unruffled,

input_text: evaṃ dhaṃmāṇi śottāna viprasīdaṃti paṇḍitā ||
target_text: just so the wise are confident after listening to Dhamma.

input_text: yassa jitaṃ nā ’ppajjīyati jitam assā na upeti antako |
target_text: He whose victory cannot be undone, whose victory does not come to an end,

input_text: taṃ buddham anomanikramaṃ apadaṃ kena padena nehisi ||
target_text: the Buddha, the one of superior effort, by what path will you lead the pathless one?

input_text: yassa jālinī visattikā tahnā nāsti kahiṃ ci netaye |
target_text: For him there is no desire, attachment, or craving to lead him anywhere,

input_text: taṃ buddham anantagocaraṃ apadaṃ kena padena nehisi ||
target_text: the Buddha, whose range is endless, by what path will you lead the pathless one?

input_text: āsavavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about the Pollutants

input_text: 18. dadantī
target_text: 18. The Chapter about Giving

input_text: dadantiveyathāśraddhaṃ yathāprasādanaṃ janā |
target_text: The people give according to faith, according to their confidence,

input_text: tattha yo duṃmano hoti paresaṃ pānabhojane |
target_text: herein the one who becomes depressed because of food and drink given to others,

input_text: na so divā ca rātto ca samādhim adhigacchati ||
target_text: does not, either by day or night, attain to good concentration.

input_text: yassa cetaṃ samucchinnaṃ mūlo ’gghaccaṃ samūhataṃ |
target_text: For the one in whom this depression is cut off, destroyed at the root, dug up,

input_text: sa ve divā ca rātto ca samādhim adhigacchati ||
target_text: does, by day and night, attain to good concentration.

input_text: aśśo va bhadro kaṣāya puṭṭho ātāpino saviṃgaṇo carāṇo |
target_text: Like a good horse touched by the whip, living ardent and spiritually intense.

input_text: śraddhāya sīlena ca vīriyeṇa ca samādhinā dhammavipaśśanāya ca |
target_text: Having faith, virtue and energy, concentration and insight into the Dhamma,

input_text: te khāntisoracchasamādhisaṃṭhitā śutassa praṃñāya ca sāram ajjhagū ||
target_text: well-established in patience, meekness and concentration, they have come to the essence of wisdom and learning.

input_text: yo driṣṭe dhaṃme labhati śraddhāṃ praṃñāṃ anuttarāṃ |
target_text: He who acquires faith and wisdom unsurpassed in this very life,

input_text: sa ve mahaddhano loke moham aṃñaṃ bahuṃ dhanaṃ ||
target_text: has great wealth in the world, other wealth, though great, is useless.

input_text: śraddho sīlena saṃpanno yaśabhogasamāhito |
target_text: The faithful one who is possessed of virtue, and has wealth and fame,

input_text: yaṃ yaṃ so bhajate deśaṃ tattha tattheva pūjiyo ||
target_text: whatever district he resorts to, right there and then he is worshipped.

input_text: śraddhābitiyaṃ puruṣaṃ carantaṃ na naṃ labheyā aśraddho va cāro |
target_text: Faith is a person’s travelling companion, he would not accept travelling without faith,

input_text: yaśo ca kittī ca tato nam eti saggaṃ ca gacche śarīraṃ prahāya ||
target_text: from that there will be fame and renown for him, and when he abandons the body he goes to heaven.

input_text: aśraddho akataṃñū ca saṃdhicchedo ca yo naro |
target_text: The person who is beyond mere faith, who knows that which is unmade, who has cut off rebirth-linking,

input_text: hatāvakāśo vāntāśo sa ve uttimaporuṣo ||
target_text: who has destroyed the occasion, who has thrown out hope and desire, is surely the person supreme.

input_text: kiccho buddhāna uppādo kicchā dhammassa deśanā |
target_text: It is rare the arising of Buddhas, rare the teaching of the Dhamma,

input_text: kiccho śraddhapaṭīlābho kicchaṃ māccāna jīvitaṃ ||
target_text: it is rare to acquire faith, rare is the life of mortals.

input_text: anavaṭṭhitacittassa saddhaṃmam avijānato |
target_text: For the one with unsettled mind, who does not know the True Dhamma,

input_text: pāriplavaprasādassa praṃñā na paripūrati ||
target_text: whose confidence is wavering, wisdom is unfulfilled.

input_text: nāprasannacittena duṣṭena kupitena vā |
target_text: For one who has a mind lacking confidence, that is base or agitated,

input_text: śakkam ājānituṃ dhammo sāraṃbhabahulena vā ||
target_text: and frequently impetuous, it is not possible to understand the Dhamma.

input_text: yo tu vinīya sāraṃbhaṃ aprasādaṃ ca cetaso |
target_text: He who has removed impetuosity, displeasure from his mind,

input_text: prasannacitto sumano sa ve nyāyyā subhāṣitaṃ ||
target_text: with confident mind, happy, he can understand well-spoken words.

input_text: manuṣyapaṭilābhena saggānāṃ gamanena ca |
target_text: Acquiring birth as a human, or going to the heavens,

input_text: pṛthivyām ekarājjena sotāpattiphalaṃ varaṃ ||
target_text: or having sole sovereignty over the earth—better is the fruit of stream-entry.

input_text: yassa śraddhā tathāgate acalā supratiṣṭhitā |
target_text: He whose faith in the Realised One is well-established and unmoveable,

input_text: śīlañ ca yassa kallāṇaṃ ayirakāntaṃ praśaṃsiyaṃ ||
target_text: whose virtue is beautiful, praised by the noble ones,

input_text: saṃghe prasādo yassa asti ujjubhūtañ ca daṃśanaṃ |
target_text: who has confidence in the Saṅgha, who sees uprightly,

input_text: adaridro ti tam āhu amoghaṃ tassa jīvitaṃ ||
target_text: he they say is ‘not poor’, his life is not in vain.

input_text: tassā śraddhañ ca śīlaṃ ca prasādaṃ dhammadaṃśane |
target_text: Therefore with faith, virtue, confidence and insight into Dhamma,

input_text: anuyuñjeya medhāvī saraṃ buddhāna śāsanaṃ ||
target_text: a sage should devote himself to the essence of the Buddhas’ dispensation.

input_text: dadantīvarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Giving

input_text: caranti bālā dummedhā amitteṇa-r-iva āttanā |
target_text: Stupid fools live having themselves as their own foes,

input_text: karontā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ yaṃ hoti kaṭukapphalaṃ ||
target_text: committing wicked deeds, which produce bitter fruit.

input_text: kathañ ca taṃ kare kaṃmaṃ yaṃ kattā anutappati |
target_text: How could he do that deed, which, having done, one has regret,

input_text: yassa aṃśumukho rodaṃ vipākaṃ paṭisevati ||
target_text: for which he has tears on his face, as the result follows him round.

input_text: taṃ ca kaṃmaṃ kataṃ sādhu yaṃ kattā nānutappati |
target_text: But that deed is well done, which, having done, one has no regret,

input_text: yassa pratīto sumano vipākaṃ paṭisevati ||
target_text: for which he is pleased and happy, as the result follows him round.

input_text: yāvad eva anatthāya ñāttaṃ bālassa jāyati |
target_text: As far as learning arises for a fool, it is only to his disadvantage,

input_text: hanti bālassa śukrāṅggaṃ (?) muddham assa nipātaye ||
target_text: it destroys the fool’s good quality, and it will destroy his head.

input_text: asatāṃ bhāvanam icchanti purekkhārañ ca bhikkhusu |
target_text: He wishes for the respect that is lacking, and status amongst the monastics,

input_text: āvāsesu ca essariyaṃ pūjāṃ parakulesu ca ||
target_text: for control in the living quarters, and worship amongst good families:

input_text: mameva katamannentu gṛhī pravrajitā ca ye |
target_text: “Householders and renunciants should think this was done by me,

input_text: na me pratibalā assa kiccā ’kiccesu kesuci ||
target_text: let none be a match for me, in all to be done and not done”,

input_text: iti bālassa saṃkappo icchāmāno ca vaddhati |
target_text: so does the fool think, meanwhile his desires and conceit increase.

input_text: aṃñā hi lābhopaniśā aṃñā nibbāṇagāminī ||
target_text: For the means to gains is one thing, the path going to Nibbāna another,

input_text: evam etaṃ yathābhūtaṃ paśśaṃ buddhassa sāvako |
target_text: thus seeing this as it really is the disciple of the Buddha

input_text: sakkāraṃ nābhinandeyā vivekam anubrūhaye ||
target_text: should not delight in honours, but practise in solitude.

input_text: jayaṃ ve manyate bālo vācāya paruṣaṃ bhaṇaṃ |
target_text: The fool thinks there is success, when he speaks words that are rough,

input_text: satāṃ hesa jayo hoti yā titikkhā vijānato ||
target_text: but for the one who knows, endurance is the success of the good.

input_text: abalaṃ tassa balaṃ hoti yassa bālabalaṃ balaṃ |
target_text: Without power is the power of him whose power is the power of a fool,

input_text: balassa dhammaguttassa paṭivattā na vijjati ||
target_text: reproach is not found for the powerful one, protected by Dhamma.

input_text: yo bālo bālamānī paṇḍito cāpi tattha so |
target_text: The fool who conceives he is a fool, is at least wise in that matter,

input_text: bālo tu paṇḍitamānī sa ve bālo ti vuccati ||
target_text: the fool who is proud of his wisdom, he is said to be a fool indeed.

input_text: drīghā assupato rātrī drīghaṃ śāntassa yojanaṃ |
target_text: Long is the night for one who sleeps not, long is a league for one tired,

input_text: drīgho bālānā saṃsāro saddhaṃmam avijānatāṃ ||
target_text: long is the round of births and deaths for fools who know not True Dhamma.

input_text: pūtimacche kuśāggreṇa yo naro upanahyati |
target_text: That man who wraps up rotting fish with the best fragrant grass,

input_text: kuśā pi pūtiṃ vāyanti evaṃ bālopasevanā ||
target_text: makes the fragrant grass smell rotten, and so with those who associate with fools.

input_text: tagarañ ca palāśamhi yo naro upanahyati |
target_text: That man who wraps up pinwheel in flame-tree leaves,

input_text: pattaṃ pi surabhiṃ vāti evaṃ dhīropasevanā ||
target_text: makes even the leaf fragrant, and so with those who associate with the wise.

input_text: akaronto pi ce pāpaṃ karonte upasevati |
target_text: If one who does no wickedness associates with those who do,

input_text: śaṅkiyo hoti pāpamhi avaṇṇo cāssa rūhati ||
target_text: he is suspected of wickedness, and his disrepute increases.

input_text: sevamāno sevamāne saṃpuṭṭho saṃphusaṃ pare |
target_text: An associate associating with others who are touched by contacts,

input_text: śaro litto kalāpe vā alitte upaliṃpati |
target_text: like a smeared arrow in a bunch, smears that which is unsmeared,

input_text: upalepabhayā dhīro neva pāpasakhā siyā ||
target_text: fearing being smeared the wise one will not have wicked friends.

input_text: tassā phalapuṭasseva ñāyyā saṃpākam āttano |
target_text: Therefore knowing the result for oneself of the fruit container,

input_text: asanto nopaseveyā santo seveya paṇḍito ||
target_text: he should not follow the bad one, the wise one should associate with the good one.

input_text: yāvaj jīvaṃ pi ce bālo paṇḍite payirupāsati |
target_text: Even if a fool attends on a wise man for his whole life long,

input_text: neva dhammaṃ vijānāti dravvī sūparasān iva ||
target_text: he does not learn Dhamma, like the spoon learns not the taste of curry.

input_text: muhuttam api ce praṃño paṇḍite payirupāsati |
target_text: If a perceptive man attends on a wise man even for a second,

input_text: khipraṃ dhammaṃ vijānāti jivhā sūparasān iva ||
target_text: he quickly learns Dhamma, like the tongue learns the taste of curry.

input_text: nāppaṃ pāpassa maṃñeyā na me taṃ āgamiṣyati |
target_text: One should not despise a little wickedness thinking: it will not come to me,

input_text: udabindunipātena udakuṃbho pi pūrati ||
target_text: through the falling of water drops the water-pot is quickly filled,

input_text: pūrate bālo pāpassa thokathokaṃ pi ācinaṃ |
target_text: the fool, gathering bit by bit, becomes full of wickedness.

input_text: nāppaṃ puṃñassa manyeyā na me taṃ āgamiṣyati ||
target_text: One should not despise little merit thinking: it will not come to me,

input_text: pūrate praṃño puṃñassa thokathokaṃ pi ācinaṃ ||
target_text: the wise one, gathering bit by bit, becomes full of merit.

input_text: bālavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Fools

input_text: khāntī paramaṃ tapo titikkhā nibbāṇaṃ paramaṃ vadanti buddhā |
target_text: Enduring patience is the supreme austerity, Nibbāna is supreme say the Buddhas,

input_text: na hi pravrajito paropaghātī śamaṇo hoti pare vihesayāno ||
target_text: for one gone forth does not hurt another, nor does an ascetic harass another.

input_text: ahiṃsakā ye munayo niccaṃ kāyena saṃvṛtā |
target_text: Those sages without violence, constantly restrained in body,

input_text: te yānti accutaṃ ṭṭhāṇaṃ yattha gantā na śocati ||
target_text: go to the deathless Nibbāna, having gone there they do not grieve.

input_text: suprabuddhaṃ prabujjhanti sadā gotamasāvakā |
target_text: Gotama’s disciples always awake to a good wakening,

input_text: yesāṃ divā ca rātto ca ahiṃsāya rato mano ||
target_text: those who day and night have a mind that delights in non-violence.

input_text: yesāṃ divā ca rātto ca bhāvanāya rato mano ||
target_text: those who day and night have a mind that delights in cultivation.

input_text: yesāṃ divā ca rātto ca niccaṃ kāyagatā satī ||
target_text: those who day and night constantly have mindfulness of the body.

input_text: ye jhānaprasutā dhīrā nekkhaṃmo ’paśame ratā |
target_text: Those wise ones intent on meditation, who delight in the peace of renunciation,

input_text: devā pi tesaṃ prihayanti saṃbuddhānāṃ satīmatāṃ ||
target_text: even the gods are envious of them, the Sambuddhas, the ones who are mindful.

input_text: aranne yadi vā ggrāme ninne vā yadi vā thale |
target_text: Whether in the wilds or village, whether on low or on high ground,

input_text: yattha arahanto viharaṃti taṃ bhomaṃ rāmaṇīyakaṃ ||
target_text: wherever the Arahats live, that ground is surely delightful.

input_text: ekaṃ pi ce prāṇam aduṣṭacitto mettāyate kuśalī tena hoti |
target_text: If, for even one living being, one with an uncorrupt mind, has loving-kindness, there is wholesomeness in that,

input_text: sabbe ca prāṇe manasā ’nukaṃpī prabhūtam ayiro prakaroti puṃñaṃ ||
target_text: but the one with compassion in mind for all living beings, that noble one makes abundant merit.

input_text: ye sattaśaṇḍāṃ paṭhaviṃ vijettā rājariṣayo yajamānā ’nupariyagu |
target_text: Those who conquered the earth, crowded with beings, those royal seers who went round sacrificing:

input_text: aśśamedhaṃ puruṣamedhaṃ saṃmaprāsaṃ vāyupeyaṃ nirāggaḍaṃ |
target_text: the horse sacrifice, the man sacrifice, the stick-casting, the soma offering, the unobstructed—

input_text: mettassa cittassa subhāvitassa kalāṃ pi te nānubhavanti soḍaśiṃ |
target_text: compared to the one who develops his mind with loving-kindness, they do not partake of even a sixteenth part,

input_text: candaprabhāṃ tāragaṇā va sabbe ||
target_text: just as the whole host of stars do not partake of the radiance of the moon.

input_text: yo ’tha metteṇa cittena sabbe prāṇe nukaṃpati |
target_text: Then he who with a mind of loving-kindness has compassion for all living beings,

input_text: mettaṃ se sabbabhūtesu veraṃ tassa na kenaci ||
target_text: having loving-kindness towards all beings, he has no one who is hated.

input_text: yassa sabbe ahorātte ahiṃsāya rato mano |
target_text: For he who every day and night delights in a mind of non-violence,

input_text: yassa sabbe ahorātte bhāvanāya rato mano |
target_text: For he who every day and night has a mind that delights in cultivation,

input_text: yassa sabbe ahorātte niccaṃ kāyagatā satī |
target_text: For he who every day and night constantly has mindfulness of the body,

input_text: yo na hanti na ghāteti na jināti na jāpaye |
target_text: He who neither kills, nor has killed, conquers, nor has conquered,

input_text: na hi vereṇa verāṇi śāmantīha kadācanaṃ |
target_text: For not by hatred do hatreds cease at any time in this place,

input_text: avereṇa tu śāmaṃti esa dhaṃmo sanātano ||
target_text: they only cease with non-hatred, this truth is surely eternal.

input_text: pare ca na vijānaṃti vayam ettha jayāmatha |
target_text: The others do not understand that we should be successful here,

input_text: ye ca tattha vijānaṃti tato śāṃmaṃti medhakā ||
target_text: but for those here who do understand, through that, their dissensions do cease.

input_text: susukhaṃ vata jīvāmo veriṇesu averiṇo |
target_text: Let us live truly happily, without hatred, amongst those who have hatred,

input_text: veriṇesu manuṣyesu viharāma averiṇo ||
target_text: amongst humans who have hatred let us live without hatred.

input_text: susukhaṃ vata jīvāmo ussukesu anussukā |
target_text: Let us live truly happily, without longing, amongst those who are longing,

input_text: ussukesu manuṣyesu viharāma anussukā |
target_text: amongst humans who are longing let us live without longing.

input_text: susukhaṃ vata jīvāmo yesaṃ no nāsti kiṃcanaṃ |
target_text: We live truly happily enough having no possessions ourselves,

input_text: sakiñcanesu manuṣyesu viharāma akiṃcanā ||
target_text: amongst those with possessions let us live having no possessions.

input_text: yathā bubbudakaṃ paśśe yathā paśśe marīcikaṃ |
target_text: One should see it as a bubble, one should see it as a mirage,

input_text: evaṃ lokaṃ avecchānam maccurājā na paśśati ||
target_text: looking on the world in this way the King of Death does not see one.

input_text: parijinnam idaṃ rūpaṃ roganīḍaṃ prabhaṃguraṃ |
target_text: This body is worn out, a nest of disease, perishing,

input_text: bhijjīhiti pūtisaṃdeho maraṇāttaṃ hi jīvitaṃ ||
target_text: the putrid body comes to destruction, for life ends in death.

input_text: jihmaṃ ca driṣṭā dukhitaṃ ca vyādhitaṃ pretañ ca driṣṭā na cirassa mānavo |
target_text: Having seen an old man, one afflicted and sick, having seen one deceased, after not long for the student,

input_text: saṃvego tīppe (?) vipulo (?) ajāyatha acchecchi dhīro gṛhibandhanāni ||
target_text: anxiety, sharp and extensive, arose, and the wise one cut the household bonds.

input_text: khāntivarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Patience

input_text: asajjhāyamalāvedā anuṭṭhāṇamalā gharā |
target_text: Lack of repetition is the ruin of the Vedā, a lack of maintenance is the ruin of homes,

input_text: malo vaṇṇassa kosajjaṃ pramādo rakkhatāṃ malo ||
target_text: indolence is the ruin of one’s appearance, heedlessness is the ruin of those on guard.

input_text: malo istiye duccaritaṃ maccheraṃ dadatāṃ malo |
target_text: Bad conduct is a woman’s stain, stinginess is a giver’s stain,

input_text: malo pāpāni kaṃmāṇi assiṃ loke paramhi ca ||
target_text: wicked deeds are a stain both in this world and in the next.

input_text: tato malataraṃ brūmi avijjā maraṇaṃ malaṃ |
target_text: I say there is a stain worse than that, ignorance is a deadly stain,

input_text: ete male prahattāna niṃmalā caratha bhikkhavo ||
target_text: after abandoning those stains, live without stains, monastics!

input_text: ayasā tu malo samuṭṭhito tato uṭṭhāya tam eva khādati |
target_text: As a rust stain arises from iron, and arisen from that, it eats it away,

input_text: em eva vidhūnacāriyaṃ sakāni kaṃmāṇi nayanti doggatiṃ ||
target_text: so with one who is overindulgent—his deeds lead him to a bad destiny.

input_text: pāṇḍupalāśo ca dāni si yamapuruṣā pi ca te upaṭṭhitā |
target_text: You are now a withered leaf, Yama’s men stand waiting for you,

input_text: uyyogamukhe ca tiṣṭhasi pātheyaṃ pi ca te na vijjati ||
target_text: you stand at decay’s door, with no provisions for the journey found.

input_text: uyyamassa ghaṭassa āttanā kaṃmāro rajataṃ va niddhame |
target_text: You should strive and endeavour by yourself, like a smith, you should remove the stain,

input_text: niddhāntamalo anaṅgano bitiyaṃ ariyabhūmim esi ||
target_text: removing the stain, blemishless, you seek the second noble realm.

input_text: anupūrvveṇa medhāvī thokathokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe |
target_text: The sage gradually, little by little, moment by moment,

input_text: kammāro rajatasseva niddhame malam āttano ||
target_text: should remove the stain from himself, like a smith removes the stain from silver.

input_text: sujīvaṃ ahirīkena saṃkiliṣṭan tu jīvati |
target_text: Life is light for one without shame, he lives a life with defilements,

input_text: prakkhaṇḍinā pragabbheṇa kākaśūreṇa dhansinā ||
target_text: backbiting and recklessness, with the bold courage of a crow.

input_text: hirīmatā tu dujjīvaṃ niccaṃ śucigaveṣiṇā |
target_text: Life is hard when endowed with shame, for the one constantly seeking purity,

input_text: alīnenāpragabbheṇa śuddhājīvena paśśatā ||
target_text: for one sincere, and not reckless, looking for purity of life.

input_text: supaśśaṃ vajjaṃ aṃñesaṃ āttano puna duddaśaṃ |
target_text: Easy to see are others’ fault, but one’s own is hard to see,

input_text: paresām iha vajjāni uppunāti yathā busaṃ |
target_text: for one sifts other peoples’ faults like they were chaff,

input_text: āttano puna chādeti kalim va kṛtavāṃ śaṭho ||
target_text: but conceals one’s own faults, like a crafty player conceals his defeat.

input_text: sukarāṇi asādhūni āttano ahitāni ca |
target_text: Easily done are things not good, and unbeneficial for oneself,

input_text: yaṃ ve hitaṃ ca sādhuñ ca taṃ ve paramadukkaraṃ ||
target_text: but that which is beneficial and good is supremely hard to do.

input_text: yāni hitāni sādhūni tāni kurvvanti paṇḍitā ||
target_text: but only those beneficial and good are done by the wise.

input_text: alajjitavve lajjanti lajjitavve na lajjatha |
target_text: They are ashamed of what is not shameful, not ashamed of what is shameful,

input_text: abhaye bhayadaṃśāvī bhaye cābhayadaṃśino |
target_text: seeing fear in what is not fearful, not seeing fear in what is fearful,

input_text: micchadṛṣṭisamādānā sattā gacchanti doggatiṃ ||
target_text: undertaking wrong views, beings go to a bad destiny.

input_text: avajje vajjamatino vajje cāvajjasaṃñino |
target_text: Finding blame in what is blameless, not perceiving blame in what is blameable,

input_text: asāre sāramatino sāre cā ’sārasaṃñino |
target_text: Finding the essential in the unessential, and perceiving the unessential in the essential,

input_text: te sāran nādhigacchanti micchasaṃkappagocarā ||
target_text: they do not understand what is the essential, and resort to wrong intention.

input_text: sārañ ca sārato ññāttā asārañ ca asārato |
target_text: Knowing the essential in what is essential, and the unessential in what is unessential,

input_text: te sāram adhigacchanti saṃmasaṃkappagocarā ||
target_text: they understand what is essential, and resort to right intention.

input_text: ayoge yuñjiyāttānaṃ yogamhi ca ayuṃjiya |
target_text: Engaging oneself in what is not suitable, not engaging in what is suitable,

input_text: atthaṃ hettā priyaggrāhī pṛhayantatthānuyogināṃ ||
target_text: abandoning the good, grasping the loved, they envy those who endeavour for good.

input_text: malavarggaḥ
target_text: The Chapter about Stains
